question: During the electrolysis of brine, by using inert electrodes,
explanation: In the electrolysis of brine (aqueous NaCl), <katex>$Cl^-$</katex> is oxidized to <katex>$Cl_2$</katex> at the anode (preferred over oxygen due to overpotential), and <katex>$H_2O$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$H_2$</katex> at the cathode.
